title: 20 stunning cliffside beaches
text:
CNN Leadership
20 stunning cliffside beaches Updated 1159 GMT (1859 HKT) July 8, 2015 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Maya Bay, Ko Phi Phi, Thailand – Consider something spectacular for your next beach vacation. Ko Phi Phi in southern Thailand's Krabi province is an archipelago of six islands about an hour's boat ride from Phuket. On Phi Phi Leh, towering limestone cliffs surround Maya Bay's pristine beach. Hide Caption 1 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Navagio Beach, Zakynthos, Greece – Only accessible by boat, secluded Navagio Beach on the Ionian Island of Zakynthos is one of Greece's most beautiful stretches of sand. Hide Caption 2 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Legzira Beach, Morocco – Just north of Sidi Ifni along the coast of southern Morocco, the Atlantic has worn natural arches into the red stone cliffs of Legzira Beach. Go at low tide to explore. Hide Caption 3 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos McWay Cove, Big Sur, California – This is about as close as you'll get to McWay Falls unless you're an experienced kayaker. The falls tumble onto the beach in McWay Cove in Julia Pfeiffer Burns State Park along California's iconic Highway 1 in Big Sur. Climbing down to the beach is prohibited, but the beach is all yours if you can get there by water. There are more accessible beaches nearby, but the short walk to this overlook is well worth it. Hide Caption 4 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Tropea, Italy – Not all coastal cliffs are remote and windswept. Along the Calabrian Coast, in the toe of Italy's boot, the clifftop town of Tropea looks down on the clear Tyrrhenian Sea. Hide Caption 5 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos As Catedrais, Galicia, Spain – Erosion really is a wonder. On Spain's Galician coastline near Ribadeo, As Catedrais features naturally carved arches that resemble a cathedral. Hide Caption 6 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Calanque d'En Vau, near Cassis, France – Calanque d'En Vau, along the Mediterranean coast of France between Cassis and Marseille, is one of a series of steep, narrow coves and inlets cutting into the shore. The beach can be reached on foot or by boat. Hide Caption 7 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Dias Beach, Cape Point, South Africa – The wild South African cape that includes secluded Dias Beach was called the Cape of Storms by explorer Bartolomeu Dias in 1488. The beach is in Cape Point Nature Reserve. There's a scenic hike down to the shore, but the wild surf makes swimming dangerous. Hide Caption 8 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Halona Beach Cove, Oahu, Hawaii – A short hike down an unpaved path leads to Halona Beach Cove. The beach on Oahu's southern shore had a role in the 1953 movie "From Here to Eternity." Hide Caption 9 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Chiaia di Luna, Ponza, Italy – A steep rock wall surrounds Chiaia di Luna on the island of Ponza, the most visited of Italy's Pontine Islands. Hide Caption 10 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Baia do Sancho, Fernando de Noronha, Brazil – The island of Fernando de Noronha is one of Brazil's national marine parks. The island's Baia do Sancho is a peaceful spot for snorkeling and sunbathing. Hide Caption 11 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Bottom Bay, Barbados – One of Barbados' most beautiful beaches, Bottom Bay is surrounded by coral cliffs. The surf is wild here, so swimming isn't advised, but picnicking in the shade of the palms is absolutely recommended. Hide Caption 12 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos El Nido, Palawan, Philippines – In the Philippine province of Palawan, limestone karst cliffs define the tucked-in beaches and lagoons of El Nido. Hide Caption 13 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Etretat, France – Natural arches have emerged from the chalky cliffs of Etretat, France, a scene that inspired Claude Monet and other impressionists. A wide beach fronts the resort town beyond this dramatic formation. Hide Caption 14 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Porto Katsiki, Lefkada, Greece – Porto Katsiki's stunning setting draws crowds. Located on the Ionian Island of Lefkada, it's best to arrive early or late or visit during the off-season for a bigger slice of sand and a smoother arrival. The narrow road to the beach and the parking area above can get very tight. Many sunbathers arrive by boat. Hide Caption 15 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Praia da Marinha, Algarve, Portugal – Near Lagoa on southern Portugal's Algarve coast, Praia da Marinha features imposing rock formations and calm waters. There's parking above and a staircase down to the beach. Hide Caption 16 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Cape Leveque, the Kimberley, Western Australia – You've got to be committed to reach Cape Leveque. Located at the end of Western Australia's Dampier Peninsula, you'll need a four-wheel drive vehicle to navigate the rough road. After the more than three-hour drive from Broome, swim, snorkel and relax amid the red cliffs and white sandy beaches. Hide Caption 17 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Little Bay Beach, Anguilla – There are two ways to get to Anguilla's Little Bay Beach: by boat or by cliff. There's a rope that runs the length of the cliff to help climbers down or you can navigate on your own using the natural grips of the rock. Tread carefully. Hide Caption 18 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Waianapanapa State Park, Maui, Hawaii – Low volcanic cliffs surround a small black sand beach at Waianapanapa State Park, off the famous Hana Highway in Maui. Hide Caption 19 of 20 Cliffside beaches 20 photos Tulum, Mexico – Perched over the Caribbean Sea, the ancient Mayan fortress city of Tulum provides a truly one-of-a-kind beach experience. Hide Caption
